etymology.description: Depicts an elephant: ⺈ (trunk) + 𫩏 (head) + 𧰨 (body) -> elephant
etymology.interpretation: The character 象(象) (xiàng, 'elephant') is a pictogram that visually represents an elephant with distinct features: the trunk, head, and body. This straightforward depiction was used to convey the concept of an elephant.

examples.chinese: 大象步伐缓慢(大象步伐緩慢)。
小象在河边戏水(小象在河邊戲水)，妈妈紧紧护卫(媽媽緊緊護衛)。
examples.pinyin: xiǎo xiàng zài hé biān xì shuǐ, māma jǐn jǐn hùwèi
examples.english: The baby elephant splashes in the river, while its mother watches closely.

examples.chinese: 象牙被视为珍贵(象牙被視為珍貴)，常被用于雕刻(常被用於雕刻)。
examples.pinyin: xiàng yá bèi shì wéi zhēn guì, cháng bèi yòng yú diāo kè
examples.english: Ivory is considered precious and is often used for carving.
